I've had times where I've had to walk across campus at 5am to print out a paper from the computer lab, and wasn't scared at all. There are multiple safety buttons on campus to push if you feel unsafe, and there are also escorts to call if you really don't feel like you should be walking across campus alone. I have never felt more safe on a college campus.
People with school spirit! We may be a small school, but we've got a lot of pride. Eat 'em up, Kats!

My favorite place to study, or just relax is the water fountain in the mall area of campus. You can stick your feet in it on a hot day, or soak up some sun on a cooler day. Also, fun fact, whenever one of the teams on campus accomplishes something, such as our football team going to the championship last fall, they light up the main Sam statue orange!

Be creative! It's a small town, and a small campus. That's why it's so important to get involved on campus; so you have things to do! You can either sit in your dorm all day doing nothing but watch tv, or you can get out and be productive, and enjoy your time at Sam Houston :)

This past year, a new dining hall was opened for the campus, and it's extremely nice! All the food is cooked right in front of you, and you get multiple choices for food. The only problem is that if you don't have a meal plan, eating there can get expensive. We have 2 other places on campus to eat that have places like Burger King, Chick Fil A, Subway, Sushi, and Tortilla Fresca. It's over all nice, just a little pricey without a meal plan.

I loved my dorm there. I had a randomly selected roommate, and got extremely lucky since we ended up becoming good friends, and now have an apartment together with some other friends. My only regret in on-campus housing is that I didn't apply early enough to get one of the nicer dorms. There's no such thing as a bad dorm there, though. Just apply early!

The professors are challenging, and you have to keep up. Unlike how you were always told in movies, or larger universities, most professors DO take attendance, and going to class is a big deal here. Don't skip! You'll regret it come test time.

Get involved! There are so many different organizations through the college, and it really can make your college experience so much better. Whether you like, football, comics, animals, music, or movies, there's something for you there. Find it, and get involved!

I love being a student at Sam Houston. It's an extremely beautiful campus, the professors genuinely care about you, and you feel like you're really part of something great just by being on campus. Everyone is so welcoming and friendly, and the small-campus vibe is totally there.

textAfterTable: Tips for prospective students Tips I can give all of you new freshman or transfers is to get involved. There are so many different organizations to get involved in so to make friends, build resumes, help your community, and to just have fun. Also, if you wear orange on Fridays, you get free stuff. I also advise you to go to all school activities because Sam gives you so many opportunities to win free stuff. Bang for the buck I did not, and do not, have the luxury of having a lot of money. I work hard, but college, especially 4 year institutions, has gotten so much more expensive. Sam is very affordable considering how nice the campus really is. Sam provides a large scholarships, loans, grants, and a low tuition cost so that students may get a quality education and more for their money. Am enjoying being here Sam Houston is really a beautiful campus. I like that it is in a small town and not in a busy city. It allows you to get used to being on your own but not so much that you are overwhelmed. It is very much a college town and it is nice that everyone seems to know everybody.
